PAL.NAME: Microsoft Lync Server 2010 - Mediation
PAL.DESCRIPTION: Performance counter thresholds for Microsoft Lync Server 2010 Mediation Server.

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:MediationServer - 02 - Media Relay - 000 - Candidates Missing
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Number of times Media stack does not have Media relay candidates.

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:MediationServer - 02 - Media Relay - 001 - Media Connectivity Check Failure
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \LS:MediationServer - 02 - Media Relay\- 001 - Media Connectivity Check Failure

DATASOURCE.NAME: \LS:MediationServer - 02 - Media Relay\- 001 - Media Connectivity Check Failure
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \LS:MediationServer - 02 - Media Relay\- 001 - Media Connectivity Check Failure

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \LS:MediationServer - 02 - Media Relay\- 001 - Media Connectivity Check Failure
CHART.DATASOURCE: \LS:MediationServer - 02 - Media Relay\- 001 - Media Connectivity Check Failure

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Number of media connectivity check failures.
This counter is total-based. The # of failed calls in the performance data will be from the start of the Mediation Server service and not the start of the data collection. The key here is that this number is as close to zero as possible.

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:MediationServer - 03 - Health Indices - 000 - Load Call Failure Index
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \LS:MediationServer - 03 - Health Indices\- 000 - Load Call Failure Index
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Scaled index between zero and 100 that is related to all call failures due to heavy load

DATASOURCE.NAME: \LS:MediationServer - 03 - Health Indices\- 000 - Load Call Failure Index
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \LS:MediationServer - 03 - Health Indices\- 000 - Load Call Failure Index

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \LS:MediationServer - 03 - Health Indices\- 000 - Load Call Failure Index
CHART.DATASOURCE: \LS:MediationServer - 03 - Health Indices\- 000 - Load Call Failure Index

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:MediationServer - 04 - Global Counters - 001 - Total failed calls caused by unexpected interaction from the Proxy
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \LS:MediationServer - 04 - Global Counters\- 001 - Total failed calls caused by unexpected interaction from the Proxy
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The number of calls that failed because of unexpected interaction from the Proxy

DATASOURCE.NAME: \LS:MediationServer - 04 - Global Counters\- 001 - Total failed calls caused by unexpected interaction from the Proxy
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \LS:MediationServer - 04 - Global Counters\- 001 - Total failed calls caused by unexpected interaction from the Proxy

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \LS:MediationServer - 04 - Global Counters\- 001 - Total failed calls caused by unexpected interaction from the Proxy
CHART.DATASOURCE: \LS:MediationServer - 04 - Global Counters\- 001 - Total failed calls caused by unexpected interaction from the Proxy

THRESHOLD.NAME: Total failed calls caused by unexpected interaction from the Proxy >= 10

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:MediationServer - 05 - Global Per Gateway Counters - 000 - Total failed calls caused by unexpected interaction from a gateway
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \LS:MediationServer - 05 - Global Per Gateway Counters(*)\- 000 - Total failed calls caused by unexpected interaction from a gateway

DATASOURCE.NAME: \LS:MediationServer - 05 - Global Per Gateway Counters(*)\- 000 - Total failed calls caused by unexpected interaction from a gateway
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \LS:MediationServer - 05 - Global Per Gateway Counters(*)\- 000 - Total failed calls caused by unexpected interaction from a gateway

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \LS:MediationServer - 05 - Global Per Gateway Counters(*)\- 000 - Total failed calls caused by unexpected interaction from a gateway
CHART.DATASOURCE: \LS:MediationServer - 05 - Global Per Gateway Counters(*)\- 000 - Total failed calls caused by unexpected interaction from a gateway

THRESHOLD.NAME: Total failed calls caused by unexpected interaction from a gateway >= 10

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
The number of calls that failed because of unexpected interaction from a gateway.
This counter is total-based. The # of failed calls in the performance data will be from the start of the Mediation Server service and not the start of the data collection. The key here is that this number is as close to zero as possible.
